utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I was wondering if you could tell us what brought you in to see us.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I just came in. I was a bit worried because I've been having this cough for around two years, which has been getting worse. But recently I've noticed that I see streaks of blood in the sputum that I'm producing. Before it just used to be like white but now I'm seeing over the last, I would say two months occasionally some streaks of blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and the cough started two years ago.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And, it's been gradually getting worse over that time?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I would say so. It's getting more frequent and worse in nature.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how much sputum are you bringing up an in a day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Probably like a, a couple teaspoons.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh, is are you seeing like bright red blood when you're when you're coughing it up?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh. In this it's kind of mixed into the sputum. I would say like, but it definitely is red.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how much blood would you say that you're you're bringing up would be teaspoons? Or a Cup? Or?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. It's just like a little streaks. It's not really significant, it doesn't feel like the whole production of the sputum, but just like little streaks that I've noticed.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and um is the cough worse, at any particular time of day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, it definitely gets worse when I'm doing more activities and then also when I get like some viral infections. But other than that, it's pretty much always there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, anything that that makes it worse? You said some viral infections. Have you had a viral infection recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, like in the last two years, I've probably had two or three viral infections, just just just cold cold symptoms.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Has there been anything that you've tried to make the cough better?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've tried the Tylenol Cold, hasn't really worked. Tried just other over the counter medications, haven't really worked.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And prior to two years ago um, were you experiencing any similar symptoms like, uh, like this cough or bringing up blood before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: In the past, I've always had a somewhat of a cough like I have COPD. So I've always had a little bit of a cough here and there, but over the last two years I feel that it's been getting much worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you been diagnosed with chronic bronchitis before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah I think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and so with with this cough and now blood tinged sputum, have you been experiencing any other symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I do feel sometimes I get like more tired than I used to throughout the day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, sometimes I also feel more breathless on when I'm exerting myself more.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you been having any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you lost any weight?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've actually lost a significant amount of weight. I would say within the last 1 and a 1/2 months probably lost like 8 to 10 pounds.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you been trying to lose weight?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not really I've just been sitting around like I can barely walk that much anymore too. I used to be able to walk at least 400 meters around the block, but now I can barely even go to the kitchen.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, is this because of the shortness of breath when you are are exerting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that and I just start coughing so much that I just have to sit down.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um, and have you been having any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No headaches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and how about and how is your appetite been?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I think it's been pretty much the same. Sometimes when I'm coughing a lot, I don't feel like eating, but other than that it's been around the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any runny nose or sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And then how about a loss of smell or a loss of taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you been having any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any heart palpitations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any wheezing when you're breathing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sometimes I would say like when when, it gets worse when I'm exerting myself more, I I can get some wheezing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you noticed any swelling in your feet or ankles?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And have you woken up at night extremely short of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I'm pretty fine during the night.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright And, uh, have you been having any abdominal pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any urinary problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any bowel problems like diarrhea or constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, any skin rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any joint pains or or muscle pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any weakness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not weakness, I'll just say more fatigue.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright so I know you told me a COPD, but do you have any other medical diagnosis?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I have high blood pressure as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think I have high cholesterol too.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, OK. Do you take any medications regularly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so for the cholesterol taking Rosuvastatin and I forget what I'm taking for the blood pressure, but it's pretty well under control.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you use any inhalers for COPD?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I used to. I used to have I think like 3 different inhalers but haven't had to use them for more than 10 years now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and what was the reason for not needing them anymore?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just didn't have any symptoms for a pretty long time and my doc said like if I don't really need them then I could just stop.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any recent hospitalizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any allergies to medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any surgeries that you had in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No surgeries.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, And are your vaccinations up to date?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yup.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and could you tell me a little bit about your social situation or living situation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so currently I'm just living by myself in an apartment. I've been there for more than 10 years now. Um, I am retired so I'm not working anymore. But yeah, that's that's me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, great um. What did you do previously for for work? Did you have any exposures for two chemicals or dusts or asbestos? Things like of that nature?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh yes, I worked in the steel factory for most of my working life. I think yeah, there might have been some exposures to chemicals and dust particles. Asbestos I don't think there was exposure, but definitely I may have lived in places that had asbestos. I mean, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how long have you been living where you you've been now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So this this is like the one I'm living in is a new place, but before that, I lived in another apartment for around five years and that was a pretty old building.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you have any pets?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No pets, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um. And do you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I smoke, I'd say around 20 cigarettes a day right now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and did you smoke more previously?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I think I've been smoking for almost like 40 years now and I used to smoke up to 30 cigarettes a day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you smoke cannabis?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um just maybe a couple times a month. Nothing, nothing throughout the week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so do you use any recreational drugs like IV drugs or opioids or cocaine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And anybody in the family have any similar symptoms before like coughing up blood or?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. Not that I know of. My father passed away from a heart attack when he was in his 60s. And I think my mother had a, um like I think one of the like, an arthritis. But yeah, like, but I think that was just like the one that you get with old age.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, like osteoarthritis?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah that that was the one.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any cancers in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, not that, one of my uncles had like um bladder cancer, but that's that's that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you have you traveled anywhere recently or been around any sick contacts? Possibly people anybody who's had tuberculosis or any infections?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been pretty much to myself over the last few months, so not really.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um. Was there anything that you're worried that this could be?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um Yeah, just the blood I kind of got scared maybe I thought like you know what if it's a cancer? One of my friends had lung cancer and I I know I've been smoking for most of my life, so that's something I was worried about.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, I can certainly see that the concern and I understand where you're coming from. I think it would be very reasonable to investigate that today. So we'll start with a chest CT along with some lab work and we will get a CBC and some electrolytes, also get an ECG as well to just check your heart and we will see what what the investigations show

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sounds good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and um, other things that um to think about this could be, uh, also like to COPD I know it's been going on a long time, but possibly could have a pneumonia that's been lingering on, particularly if it's a fungal type of infection and as well as things like you mentioned you possibly unsure if you've had an asbestos exposure in the past and stuff like that can possibly lead to scarring of the lung, and so all of these factors will be looked into.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, sounds good. Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
